servinfo.title: DTC P0300 / P0301 / P0302 / P0303 / P0304: Random Misfire Detected / Cylinder 1 / Cylinder 2 / Cylinder 3 / Cylinder 4 Misfire Detected

servinfosub.title: System Description
servinfosub.ptxt: ECM measures the angle of the crankshaft based on the pulse signal from the CKP sensor and CMP sensor for each cylinder. If it detects a large change in the angle speed of the crankshaft, it concludes occurrence of a misfire. When the number of misfire is counted by ECM beyond the DTC detecting condition, it determines the cylinder where the misfire occurred and output it as DTC.

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

item.ptxt: Misfire, which causes catalyst to overheat during 200 engine revolutions, is detected at 2 or more cylinders. (MIL flashes as long as this misfire occurs continuously.)
Misfire, which affects exhaust emission adversely during 1000 engine revolution, is detected at 2 or more cylinders. (2 driving cycle detection logic)
Misfire, which causes catalyst to overheat during 200 engine revolutions, is detected at 1 cylinder. (MIL flashes as long as this misfire occurs continuously.)
Misfire, which affects exhaust emission adversely during 1000 engine revolution, is detected at 1 cylinder. (2 driving cycle detection logic)
When performing a road test, select a place where there is no traffic or possibility of a traffic accident and be very careful during testing to avoid occurrence of an accident.
Road test should be carried out by 2 persons, a driver and a tester, on a level road.

attention3.ptxt: Check to make sure that following conditions are satisfied when using this “DTC Confirmation Procedure”.

item.ptxt: Intake air temperature at engine start: –10 °C (14 °F) to 80 °C (176 °F)
Altitude (barometric pressure): 2400 m, 8000 ft or less (560 mmHg, 75 kPa or more)

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and print Freeze Frame Data or write them down using scan tool.
Drive vehicle under freeze frame data condition as noted for 1 min. or more.
Stop vehicle and check DTC and pending DTC.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting:M16A and J20A .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:M16A and J20A .

testgroup.question: Does fuel level meter indicate “E” level (empty)?

test1.ptxt: Check that there is fuel of good quality in the fuel tank.

action.ptxt: Clean in fuel system circuit and change fuel.

test1.ptxt: Check spark plug and ignition spark of cylinder where misfire occurs, referring to Spark Plug Inspection:M16A and J20A and Ignition Spark Test:M16A and J20A .

action.ptxt: Faulty ignition coil, wire harness, spark plug or other system parts.

testgroup.title: Fuel injector circuit check

test1.ptxt: Using sound scope, check each injector operating sound at engine cranking or idling.

testgroup.question: Do all injectors make operating sound?

action.ptxt: Check coupler connection and wire harness of injector not making operating sound and injector itself. If OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check fuel pressure referring to Fuel Pressure Check:M16A and J20A .
Check fuel injector(s) referring to Fuel Injector Inspection:M16A and J20A .
Check ignition timing referring to Ignition Timing Inspection:M16A and J20A .
Check EGR system referring to EGR System Inspection:M16A and J20A .
Check exhaust system for exhaust gas clogged.
Check engine mechanical parts or system which can cause engine rough idle or poor performance.

item.ptxt: Engine compression (Refer to Compression Check:J20A or Compression Check:M16A .)
Valve lash (Refer to Valve Lash (Clearance) Inspection:J20A or Valve Lash (Clearance) Inspection:M16A .)
Valve timing (Refer to 2nd Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation:J20A or Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation:M16A .)

action.ptxt: Check wire harness and connection of ECM ground, ignition system and fuel injector for intermittent open and short.
